availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, 1859-1862

body.p: I have learned through the representations of Maj R. R. Willimas, Mr Lucien Anderson and others that Mr Bolinger a citizen of Mayfield has been unlawfully seized and is now under arrest at Columbus, this is to request you to proceed to Columbus and request that he may be released by the parties who detain him And it being represented to me that his life would be in danger if he is released and left to proceed home unprotected, you will furnish him such a guard as may be necessary for his safe transit to his home or other place of safety
